description: Great game! There are settings: "Light", " Normal "and"Heavy". Wonderful! Thanks.
I get checked and even though i can take the queen with my horse it ignores the horse completely and forces me to move king out of check.

Not only is the EASY mode almost impossibly hard, but the game itself restricts the player from playing moves that might lead to his /hers victory.

Example: Well within the match, the game simply prevented me from mowing the pawn two spaces ahead (from starting point) and thus making an advantage for possible victory. Yes, it is that cheating.

To the developers: Change this Genghis-Khan algorithm and learn some chess basics. Absolute blasphemy.
summary: Terrible, terrible chess - hard and cheating

description: la,ji,la,ji,la,ji,la,ji,la,ji,la,ji,la,ji,la,ji

Love it! I'm personally using the Sjeng Engine(Same engine that Apple uses for Mac Chess) If you are having any issues with game play, I highy suggest that you download the Sjeng Engine. Not all Engines perform the same.

To use the Sjeng Engine run sudo apt-get install sjeng in your terminal after the engine installs open up preferences then under opposing player you will see your old engine and the sjeng engine select Sjeng. Note Engine settings do not take effect until you start a new game.

The following is a list of all supported chess engines.
https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Chess/ChessEngines


Hope this helps.

description:
The app is decent, in a sense that is is a chess app where you can play against the computer. I am a beginner in chess but I can beat normal level without much trouble for both white and black.

Move animation is a bit slow for me and there is no way to disable it. Computer repeates moves in the same position which limits the variability of the game. 

In my opinion adding more difficulty levels and types of play (defensive, aggressive) will make this app a perfect opponent for chess players without internet connection.

Overall a suitable chess app to spend some time when you have no access to lichess website.

description: you cannot win, if you are winning the game stops

the game is programmed so that you can't make a move that would lead to a win.
This (snap) version doesn't have the options menu, just load and save buttons. I apt install'd it and the options menu is there.

Before you think "well maybe this person just isn't good at chess," let me explain. I was losing on the "Easy" setting every game. So, I analyzed a game with Stockfish 10, one of the worlds most powerful chess engines, and played the perfect move against it every time. 

In the 37 move game, the GNOME Chess computer (on "Easy" I remind you) made only 1 mistake and 1 blunder. Wow, so maybe it's "easy" to beat a computer who makes only 2 non-perfect moves if you are a FIDE Grandmaster, but even Grandmasters make mistakes. My gosh, this engine is WAY overpowered.
summary: Works well, but nearly impossible difficulty

description: I won my first game on easy mode today after playing countless number of games. When I finally checkmated the other side the game crashed saying "Oops! Something has gone wrong. The computer player is confused. The game cannot continue." Fix this please.

The program is OK, not an awesome nor a bad chess app. But in these modern days if they want to survive, need improve a lot. In the visual aspect, my problem it's that available squares of the piece you want to move appears an vanished image of the piece each square. The moves are displayed slowly. There it's not a menu for configuring different play style (Bullet, Blitz, Rapid, etc.) and the registration of the move is too large, it would be better the short algebraic form.
summary: There is too much to be done

description: This is wonderful

I think this is a great chess app, but I have a few concerns and suggestions:

-The ability to play chess variants like suicide, losers (as you can on the built-in chess app on the Mac) would be very nice.

-I'd also like to be able to customize piece colors.
-But most importantly: THE SO-CALLED "EASY" DIFFICULTY IS ACTUALLY B*LL-BUSTING HARD TO THE POINT THAT YOU NEED TO BE A KASPEROV-SCALE GRANDMASTER IN ORDER TO WIN. It checkmates me 98% of the time, often in no more than twenty moves. Absolutely ridiculous. You could at least add a more nuanced difficulty selection, where the easiest is completely useless, and the hardest is the existing "easy" difficulty lol
summary: Great and beautiful chess app, but too hard

description: He empezado a jugar ayer por la noche, nunca me he reído tanto con un juego de ajedrez, echo partidas rápidas casi todas en modo fácil, y a veces me dejo aconsejar por los movimientos posibles de las fichas, se pasa un rato de lo mejor que hay, muchas gracias.
la verdad se lucen siempre con estas app. Muy buena facil de jugar interactivo hasta un pequeño puede jugar vale la pena.

Sólo he jugado una partida de momento, y salvo por los gráficos que son bastante básicos y que no se puede jugar on-line (que estaría de categoría), el juego parece estar muy bien. Tiene un apartado donde dice la última jugada que se ha realizado, otro en donde puedes ver de quien es el turno. NOTA: 6,5/10
